column1: #Text=The entire process was accomplished under inert conditions.
#Text=The Cu2Se powder was fabricated by high-energy ball milling (SPEX, 8000 M Mixer/Mill) of Cu and Se powder with the stoichiometric composition of Cu2Se for 200 min.
#Text=The ball-milled powder was sieved for removing particles larger than 45 µm.
#Text=The soluble ionic Se binder was synthesized by dissolving 0.5 g of Se powder in the co-solvent of 0.5 mL ethanethiol and 4.5 mL ethylenediamine with vigorous stirring at room temperature69.
#Text=After 72 h, the dissolved solution was added 37.5 mL of isopropanol and centrifuged at 7715 × g for 10 min to precipitate of Se ion binder.
#Text=The precipitates, discarded supernatant, was dried for 1 h under vacuum condition.

#Text=The all-inorganic Cu2-xSe ink was prepared by mixing the 2.5 g of glycerol, 2 g of the ball-milled Cu2Se powder, and 1 g of dried Se ion binder with a planetary centrifugal mixer (ARM-100, Thinky) for 2 h to fully disperse.
#Text=In the mixing process, six zirconium oxide grinding balls with 5 mm diameter were added for homogenizing, effectively.
